reviewText: I played less than 20 minutes, and saw everything there is to see. This'd be a fine $5 game, but $20 is straight up robbery.
voteText: 66 of 80 people (83%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I purchased this game and enjoyed it. The controls were fantastic the haptic feedback on your racket hand when you swing is what makes this game awesome.

Pros:
Great control scheme
Hitting the tennis ball people is a lot of fun
Cons:
Not a lot of content. I played this game for about half an hour and really felt like I experienced all there is to experience. I cant see myself playing this anymore then I have.
No AI you hit the ball then teleport across the court and hit it back to yourself
No way to freely move. I had to hit the ball near where I wanted to teleport to get there, a means of teleporting to a specific location would improve this game a lot.
Price
TLDR:

Overall this game is fun put it is definitely not worth the $20 I have requested a refund but I would gladly repurchase this game and change this review if the price is lowered and when an AI is added to play against similar to WII Tennis.
voteText: 30 of 31 people (97%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Prepare for the most exciting way to play with yourself! Just put on your Vive, grab your balls & racquet, and start swinging! reviewText: This game was 25% off (~$15), so I decided it may be worth it. I was wrong. I played it for five minutes and ran out of things to do. Additionally, the one thing that it does, it doesn't do well. If you swing too fast, the racquet passes through the ball. You cannot put any type of spin on the ball, and it just doesn't seem like the ball is going in the direction that it should. Overall, it's cute, and I would probably pick it up for about $2.99. However, it definitely isn't worth the current price, or even the sale price for that matter.

recommended: the newly released HoloBall is your best bet. A quarter the price

reviewText:
I am really enjoying my time with #SelfieTennis so far.
It's really hard to describe it, but it's basically a sandbox tennis game. You are playing tennis, with yourself. You serve the ball, and your view teleports to the receiving end for you to hit the ball again.
And you can take selfies.

It's silly, and there's not currently much to it other than playing tennis (in VR) and attacking mascots with balls. But it's also very satisfying.
voteText: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful

reviewText: #SelfieTennis is a brilliant game. At our office we have sunk more hours (25+ over 3 accounts) collectively into playing with balls than in any other Vive game. Everyone can develop their own play styles, and we have a running tally of different records going: Over net (117), Under net (57), throwing the raquet (5). So much fun, and we keep going back into it day after day, for quick breaks while lighting is being rebaked, during lunch, after work, and so on.

reviewText:
I was a little hesitant to get this game given claims about lack of depth". I have to say that I was actually pretty blown away with how responsive everything felt.

It is also closest to a workout that I've had so far on the vive and I was really having fun.

And this the thing about the vive
date: simple becomes amazing again.\n\nWord of caution
recommended:
really really clear your space. I found that the difference between this and other games is there is a real force required in order to hit the ball.

I would also advise to use the straps for this one.

Lastly
hoursPlayed: when serving the ball be careful not to smash the controllers into each other."

reviewText: Strap on your HMD, grab your controllers and commence playing some tennis.  Works great as a social experience, who doesn't like having others around watching you play with yourself?\n\nDon't forget to discover what can and cannot be hit with a tennis ball and have it react.  Seriously this was the game that sold me on the Vive as a true VR experience and the one I wanted.  I have yet to load this up for someone and not have them come out if it loving it.

reviewText: This is fun, but it needs a few refinements. For those of us who play non-VR tennis, there are some problems: any kind of racquet-head speed results in missing the ball, so you have to swing very slowly. Adjusting the grip (even to an Eastern grip) causes the ball to fly into the bottom of the net. The length of the racquet is wrong on the backhand side, so you miss way more than you should. You can't slice, or put any kind of spin on the ball. If you try to put topspin on the ball, you just hit a lob that goes 10 meters up.\nI could continue, but those are some of the issues I have.

reviewText:
You knock those tennis ball people over the ledge and hearts come floating up. Then you have to hit the hearts and there's power ups and stuff inside. Trying to hit the hearts is fun in itself it's almost like the Lab archery but with tennis balls.

Update: racket physics aren't perfect but you get used to how it works I can have long volleys that feel like you're playing Tennis.  It's pretty acurate you just need to hit it harder than you woud expect.

I think some of the negative reviews played an early build.  The game is very good right now.
I play it almost every day.

reviewText: This game is grossly overpriced. If it was closer to $5-$10 I may have kept it and left a positive review, but alas I will be refunding. (played for about 6 minutes) Believe it or not my main reason for the negative review was mostly from when you hit the ball it seems to have a max speed. Things are a bit off there and needs some more speed on the ball if you hit it harder, to feel like you are playing real tennis. There is no slicing, or top spins. Once the physics are fixed a little further and the price drops I may come back. Refunding for now.
